item.title: Daniel Craig Returns to Solve “Impossible Crime” in ‘Wake Up Dead Man’ Trailer
item.description: Rian Johnson’s third ‘Knives Out’ film hits Netflix later this year and also stars Josh O’Connor, Glenn Close and Josh Brolin.

item.title: ‘Wake Up Dead Man: A Knives Out Mystery’ Review: Set in a Church Parish, and Pairing Daniel Craig and Josh O’Connor, the Third Entry in the Series May Be the Sharpest Yet

item.title: Toronto: Rian Johnson Takes Latest ‘Knives Out’ Mystery “Back to Church”
item.description: The film’s director and his star-studded cast got an amen and sustained applause Saturday night at the Toronto Film Festival for the world premiere of ‘Wake Up Dead Man: A Knives Out Mystery.’

item.title: ‘Wake Up Dead Man: A Knives Out Mystery’ Takes TIFF Audience to Church With Rapturous World Premiere

item.title: Jeremy Renner Says ‘It Felt Good’ for ‘Knives Out 3’ to Be His First Movie After Near-Death Snow Plow Accident: I Was With ‘People I Love’

item.title: ‘Poker Face’ Boss Rian Johnson Delighted in That Finale Cliffhanger Tease: “Peacock Was a Little Nervous”
item.description: Season two ended with a “To Be Continued” that put Natasha Lyonne’s starring character in peril — only to pull it back and deliver the season’s actual, yet still perilous, ending.
